climbs.name: The Royal Robbins Chiselfest
climbs.fa: Matt Samet, Cameron Burns (per Samet & Jett guide)

content.description: Harder than it looks. Some cool side pulls strenuous climbing at the start. The crux is super thin crips between the second and third bolt followed by more thought provoking climbing above.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a shared anchor with Learning to Fly to the right
content.location: Towards the right side of Power Wall, just left of gray and white colored water stained, blank section of wall. There is a pile of large broken boulders at the bottom of this route.

content.description:
This short route will test your crimping skills and skin.  Start just right of "Lights Out" pulling a roof on good jugs to obtain the second bolt and the crux.  Either grovel up on to the ledge or pull on small sharp crimps.  Clip the third bolt and power on to the anchors. 

  We cleaned off a large pillar of rock on this, making it slightly easier as the ledge is now a lot larger.  Didn't look like this one had been climbed for a while as the 4' pillar came off with a crescent wrench and kicking on it.
content.location: In the middle of Power wall, starts at a small roof.  To the right is "The Royal Robbins Chiselfest" and to the left is "Lights Out"

content.description: Stick clip the first bolt or climb up and stand on one of the intermediate edges on the bulge. From there climb though some choss and up the face. Once on the face, the holds will get exceptionally sharp.
content.protection: 4 bolts + two bolt anchor with lowering hardware
content.location: About one third of Power Wall away from the large crack that forms the left end of Power Wall. The route is right of the low angle Lil Girl's Climb and in the same red colored rock.

content.description: We added a cool 5.7+ for my lil brother and my girl to practice lead climbing on!!
content.location: The route is in between lights out and Dave's face on the power wall

content.description:
This challenging power endurance route is one of the best at New Canyon.  While short, nearly every move is challenging.  Start on good holds with one trick section to the second bolt.  Pull the crux on sharp crimps and get a quick shake at the third.  From there big moves on crimps lead to a challenging 4th clip and easier moves to the top of the wall.  Once topping out, it is easy to down climb to the anchors on "Lights On" 

  Gets a mention as one of the best short routes in New Mexico in the New Mexibolts article of climbing #273.
content.protection: 4 Bolts to its newly installed anchor complete with lowering hardware.
content.location: On the Power wall towards the start of New Canyon.  The first 2 bolts are shared with the new addition "Lights On".  To the right is "The Pervert and the Hammer", to the left is "The Need to Bleed"

content.description: CowboyCerrone and friends added two bolts and a three bolt anchor at top of this variation to the left of Light Out.  Lights On shares the first two bolts of Lights Out then forks left.
content.protection: 4 Bolts to a three bolt anchor
content.location: Find the big broken boulders at the base of The Royal Robbing Chiselfest. This is about the middle of Power Wall. Above the boulders and to the left is a shallow roof (1-2' deep). The Lights Out and Lights On climbs start just to the right of the left end of this roof. Pervert and the Hammer goes up the right side of the roof, where it begins to diminish.

climbs.name: Learning to Fly
climbs.fa: Lance Hadfield, Johnny Myrick (per Samet & Jett guide)

content.description: Easy climbing up the horizontal breaks in the rock to the blank, almost featureless face. The crux is moving through this section using balancy moves to a far left side pull. Then climb on large holds through the left side of the roof to the shared anchor with RRCF.
content.protection: 3 bolts to two bolt anchor with lowering hardware
content.location: Towards the far right side of Power Wall near the south access trail.

content.description: Dave's Face was a 3 bolt no anchor.   We added 3 bolt anchor and 2 more bolts
content.location: The far left side of power wall

content.description:
As the name states, Power Wall contains powerful climbing on thin crips and slightly overhanging rock. Lights Out, in the middle of the wall, is one of the best climbs at New Canyon. Daveâ€™s Face is also really good. 

  There are a couple top ropes on the far right side of Power Wall towards the large tree, Dizze 5.9 on the right, and The Ise Man 5.11b on the left closer to Learning to Fly.
